summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from 2020-2021 between Gary Stein, a partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP, and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The emails discuss scheduling calls and mention a court trial adjournment related to a matter concerning the 'Professional Children's School'.

persons.name: Gary Stein
persons.role: Partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP
persons.context: Attorney communicating with a federal prosecutor about scheduling calls and a court matter related to the 'Professional Children's School'.

persons.name: Elizabeth Sullivan
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Federal prosecutor copied on emails with Gary Stein regarding the 'Professional Children's School' matter.

connections.description: Communicating professionally regarding a legal matter, with Sullivan being a federal prosecutor and Stein being a private attorney.

events.title: Trial adjournment
events.description: The court adjourned a trial until November 29, 2021, as communicated in an email.

keyFacts: Gary Stein, a partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP, was in communication with a federal prosecutor about a matter concerning the 'Professional Children's School'.
A trial related to this matter was adjourned until November 29, 2021.
The emails contain standard legal confidentiality notices, indicating the sensitive nature of the communications.
The correspondence spans from February 2020 to May 2021, showing an ongoing legal matter.
The primary subject of the emails is scheduling calls to discuss next steps in the matter.
